intro: Cymbia occidentalis, commonly known as the Western cymbia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Cymaraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It is often found in coastal areas and has adapted to tolerate saline conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native habitat.
